main event: A round object, presumed to be a balloon, was observed moving with the wind at St. Louis Coast Guard Station on 6 October 1957.
interesting points: The object was the size of a basketball at arm's length., The observation lasted for 6 minutes., The report suggests the object fits the description of a launched balloon., The sightings included both visual and radar observations., Rain showers were reported at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: round object, presumed to be a balloon
